org.cloudsimplus.autoscaling

Interface VmScaling

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HorizontalVmScaling
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HorizontalVmScalingSimple

    public interface VmScaling
    An interface to allow implementing horizontal and vertical scaling of VMs.
    Since:
    CloudSim Plus 1.0
    Author:
    Manoel Campos da Silva Filho

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Predicate<Vm> FALSE_PREDICATE
      A Predicate that always returns false independently of any condition.
      static VmScaling NULL
      An attribute that implements the Null Object Design Pattern for HorizontalVmScaling objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Predicate<Vm> getOverloadPredicate()
      Gets a Predicate that defines when Vm is overloaded or not, that will make the Vm's broker to dynamically create a new Vm to balance the load of new arrived Cloudlets.
      Vm getVm()
      Gets the Vm that this Load Balancer is linked to.
      void scaleIfOverloaded(double time)
      Performs the horizontal or vertical scale if the Vm is overloaded.
      HorizontalVmScaling setOverloadPredicate(Predicate<Vm> predicate)
      Sets a Predicate that defines when Vm is overloaded or not, that will make the Vm's broker to dynamically create a new Vm to balance the load of new arrived Cloudlets.
      VmScaling setVm(Vm vm)
      Sets a Vm to this Load Balancer.

    • Field Detail

      • FALSE_PREDICATE

        static final Predicate<Vm> FALSE_PREDICATE
        A Predicate that always returns false independently of any condition.

      • NULL

        static final VmScaling NULL
        An attribute that implements the Null Object Design Pattern for HorizontalVmScaling objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getVm

        Vm getVm()
        Gets the Vm that this Load Balancer is linked to.
        Returns:

      • setVm

        VmScaling setVm(Vm vm)
        Sets a Vm to this Load Balancer. The broker will call this Load Balancer in order to balance load when its Vm is over utilized.
        Parameters:
        vm - the Vm to set
        Returns:

      • getOverloadPredicate

        Predicate<Vm> getOverloadPredicate()
        Gets a Predicate that defines when Vm is overloaded or not, that will make the Vm's broker to dynamically create a new Vm to balance the load of new arrived Cloudlets.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        setOverloadPredicate(Predicate)

      • setOverloadPredicate

        HorizontalVmScaling setOverloadPredicate(Predicate<Vm> predicate)
        Sets a Predicate that defines when Vm is overloaded or not, that will make the Vm's broker to dynamically create a new Vm to balance the load of new arrived Cloudlets.
        Parameters:
        predicate - a predicate that checks certain conditions to define that the Load Balancer's Vm is over utilized. The predicate receives the Vm to allow the predicate to define the over utilization condition. Such a condition can be defined, for instance, based on Vm's Vm.getTotalUtilizationOfCpu(double) CPU usage}.
        Returns:

      • scaleIfOverloaded

        void scaleIfOverloaded(double time)
        Performs the horizontal or vertical scale if the Vm is overloaded. The type of scale depends on implementing classes.
        Parameters:
        time - current simulation time
